Dear Amazon Associate,

We are writing to notify you that effective on March 1, 2024 (the "Effective Date"), Amazon will modify the Amazon Associates Program Operating Agreement (the "Agreement").

Modifications to the Statement are in accordance with Section 13 (Modification) of the Agreement. Pursuant to the amendment and modification provisions of the Agreement, the Statement amends, supplements and forms part of the Agreement.

Your continued participation in the related Amazon Associates Program on or after the Effective Date constitutes your acceptance of the updated Statement. If you agree to the changes, no further action is needed.

If you object to the changes, you may Contact Us, within seven days of the date of this message. If you do provide us with such notice, your participation in the related Amazon Associates Program will terminate on the Effective Date.

A summary of these changes are below :-

Use of AI

Am I still able to use to AI / automation services to aid me in creating affiliate content? Yes, the use of AI and automation services is still generally permitted for things like generating header text for a social media post or text overlays on content. Any content created using AI software must also clearly disclose that the content is 1) sponsored, and 2) generated using AI. 
What can’t I use AI for? Creators are prohibited from integrating any software or automation services to Amazon’s Product Advertising API (PAAPI) and from using Amazon data to train AI programs / LLMs.
Can I run any Amazon data through AI / automation services? No, this is not allowed.
Use of Links in Offline Messaging

What specific conditions need to be met in order for me to share links with my followers via offline message? First, any links shared via offline message must be solicited by the customer. Second, approved offline messaging only includes digital media (e.g., no physical mailers, print media, QR codes on posters would be allowed). Third, any links that are shared with customers who solicit them must have the proper disclosures.
What types of communications methods for sharing special links with customers are not allowed? Creators are not permitted to share links with customers via any phyical offline messaging mediums (e.g., print media, mailers, physical QR code displays in public).
Can I share links in emails or newsletters that I send to my audience? Yes this is allowed so long as the email/newsletter clearly discloses the fact that it is sponsored, affiliate, or ad content.
Can I share links in emails or newsletters that I send to my audience? Yes this is allowed so long as the email/newsletter clearly discloses the fact that it is sponsored, affiliate, or ad content.
Are there regulatory guidelines I need to adhere to if I share Special Links via email or in chat groups? All content containing special links must be posted in accordance with FTC guidelines. 
Can I use automation/chatbot services for DM linking? Yes, as long as chatbots reactively engage with customers who have requested to be a sent a link. Link services or chatbots must not be used to spam customers or contact anyone who have not first solicited the interaction.
Other FAQs

Am I able to use the word “dupe” in my content? Use of the word “dupe” is not permitted in content in connection with a brand or when used to knowingly promote counterfeit products or products that infringe the intellectual property rights of others. We recommend terms such as “similar to” over “dupe,” however, certain uses of the word “dupe” which are permittable (i.e., not mentioned in connection with a brand) may not result in a warning or violation to a given creator.
